qas.question: What was Carl Laemmle Jr.'s nickname?
What movie was based on an Edna Ferber novel?
In what year was the musical Broadway produced?
What movie won the 1930 Academy Award for Best Picture?

answers.text: All Quiet on the Western Front

qas.question: What all-color musical did Universal make in 1930?
What 1930 film based on Edna Farber's novel did Universal produce?
What 1929 all-color musical feature did Universal produce?

plausible_answers.text: All Quiet on the Western Front

qas.question: What 1929 film won its year's Best Piture Oscar?

context: "<a0_0>Junior<a0_0/>" Laemmle persuaded his father to bring Universal up to date. He bought and built theaters, converted the studio to sound production, and made several forays into high-quality production. His early efforts included the critically mauled part-talkie version of Edna Ferber's novel <a1_0><b5_0>Show Boat<b5_0/><a1_0/> (<a2_0>1929<a2_0/>), the lavish musical <b6_0>Broadway<b6_0/> (1929) which included Technicolor sequences; and the first all-color musical feature (for Universal), <a4_0><b7_0>King of Jazz<b7_0/><a4_0/> (1930). The more serious <a3_0><b8_0>All Quiet on the Western Front<b8_0/><a3_0/> (1930), won its year's Best Picture Oscar.
